message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DB, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.AR

The paper discusses the use of near-data processing (NDP) for machine learning, specifically for training differentiable models using stochastic gradient descent (SGD). This topic falls under the categories of distributed computing (cs.DC) and databases (cs.DB) due to the use of multiple NAND channels for parallelization and the storage and retrieval of data from the SSD. The paper also involves artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE) due to the focus on machine learning algorithms and their training. Finally, the paper touches on computer architecture (cs.AR) as it discusses the design and implementation of a simulator for a realistic multi-channel SSD.
